output_json.summary:
Position: Plant Engineer
REOPRTS TO: Director of Operations
LOCATION: Columbus, OH
SALARY: $150K - $200K - (Relocation assistance available)
job_responsibilities: Develop, execute, and manage activities aimed at maintaining/improving asset availability and reliability.
Restore equipment to base condition— inherent levels of reliability and safety—when deterioration occurs.
Assist in all phases of facility expansions and modifications.
Manage plant Mechanical and Electrical support systems.
Manage all assigned projects in a manner that will ensure completion within the approved project schedule and budget.
Direct and oversee assigned contractor personnel in activates relating to the implementation of assigned projects.
Supports and ensures compliance with quality, environmental, business policies and state standards associated with such management systems.
Develop standardized documentation including SOP’s, training, and validation of equipment reliability.
Responsible for planning and monitoring capital investment expenditures.
Establishes key interfaces and builds relationships with internal customers and key team members in support of alignment of CAPEX project goals.
Identify and manage relationships with preferred equipment manufacturers, specialists, and technical support consultants.
Identify and correct chronic, repetitive, and costly electrical equipment and other systems problems.
Support turnarounds planned and unplanned outages, major electrical equipment overhauls, routine, and non-routine repairs.
Provide electrical engineering support to maintenance and operations teams.
Obtain the information necessary for design improvement for equipment and systems where inherent reliability is inadequate.
Provide engineering support as needed and be on-call for critical plant/asset electrical or other systems failures.

Work closely with manufacturing teams at all levels to resolve technical issues, applying engineering and technical skills to design, optimize, and troubleshoot electrical and other systems equipment.
Improve equipment and system reliability, safety, and sustainability at minimum total cost.
Perform technical analysis, testing, calculations, and evaluation of results to solve complex engineering and reliability problems.
Lead failure analysis of electrical and other systems/equipment and educate both maintenance and production technicians after failure analysis.
Maintain and update plant electrical drawings and files as needed.

other.content: 5+ years’ technical experience in a production environment. Project management and environmental experience required.
